author: daxian-dbw
body:
# PR Summary

Avoid the `int[]` and `int[,]` allocation when tokenizing line comments and matching wildcard pattern by
1. Reusing the same 2-dimensional integer array for processing line comments in the same `Tokenizer`.
2. Use `ArrayPool<int>` in `PatternPositionVisitor` to avoid creating transient `int[]`.

These two changes reduces the allocation of `int[]` and `int[,]` significantly in the command discovery scenario where module analysis is required. See the allocation comparison below:
(given line comment tokenizing and wildcard matching are relatively hot code path, this change could improve other scenarios too)

#### Before the change
`int[,]` -- 3.8 mb
`int[]` -- 2.3 mb

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/127450/60194699-af442480-97ee-11e9-9003-32abfbe97596.png)

#### After the change

`int[,]` -- 200 kb
`int[]` -- 280 kb

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/127450/60194929-16fa6f80-97ef-11e9-9507-154c1a858e95.png)
